conclusion: Analyze the processes involved in the change of the ideal gas from state A to state B.
State A: VA = V0, TA = T0, PA = P0. State B: VB = 2V0, TB = 2T0, PB = 2P0.
The work done by the gas during the process from A to B is W = -10 J.
Use the ideal gas law to find the pressure in state B.
PB VB = n R TB and PA VA = n R TA, leading to TB = 4T0.
Determine the work done during the process from A to B if it were an isobaric process.
The process is isochoric, so the work done is Wisochoric = 0.
Determine the heat absorbed by the gas during the process from A to B.
Use the ideal gas law for state A: PA VA = n R TA.
Determine the work done during the process from B to C.
The process from B to C is such that the extension line of BC is over the origin.
